GOD.content: God of Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, not the God of philosophers of ontotheology, but one who interrupts & retracts his order
Abraham’s silence, secrecy of unforgivable, decision, would have “to be forgiven by the one he obeyed”
Judaic God repents, feels remorse, takes back his commands—i.e. the flood, his gesture resembles a confession, a plea for forgiveness [Christ is constantly taking back?]

LOBL.content: je m’arrête > “same interdiction encrypts the resurrection at the moment when he sees the terrible Chose”
terribleness of la chose, not only ineffable, unnarratable: it’s interdictory, it forbids telling/seeing
interdiction violated by itself, sets in motion a single pas, overflows impossible récit, that which forbids happens [French? arriver?]

HASD.content: [in Christian apophatics of Dionysus] cause, gift of gift, order and promise are the same
order or promise, injunction commits (me) to sign, in a rigorously asymmetrical manner, to reappropriate for myself and restore the symmetry
to deny, elude responsibility, it’s still necessary that I countersign it

MPM.content: [re: de Man closer to Heidegger than he thinks] for Heidegger, memory too, like promise, gathers near what can come, toward the “future” > es gibt never gives anything in present, it calls as a promise; Heissen (“to call, ” “to command” > entrust, keep safely)

POOF.content: in Aristotle, honor saves friendship from calculation, from the market—still, it’s proportioned via hierarchy, a hierarchy as sacralization of the beginning, qua command (arkhé)

A.content: absolute arrivant, no more commands than commanded by memory of originary event where archaic is bound to final extremity (telos, eskhaton)
request for foundation or for condition of possibility speaks language of methodic order: 1) an order as in a whole 2) an order as in a sequence 3) an order as in a command

VM.content: Levinas’ critique of state’s alienation neither Marxist, nor Hegelian, nor anarchist, since his is a philosophy of “principle as commandment”

PP.content: an inscription, Delphikon gramma [Phaedrus (229d)], anything but oracle, prescribes silent cipher, signifies, orders autoscopy, autognosis [re: Socrates’ send-off of myths]
certain voice, command of logos that Socrates obeys > forbids more than it bids (qui interdit plutôt qu’elle ne dicte)

OH.content: Europe: representation or figure of a universal idea; has confused its face, figure, w/ a point, a phallus; the idea of an advanced point of exemplarity is the idea of the European idea, eidos, archē, telos, the idea of beginning, commanding, cap, captain, towards an accomplished end
advanced point is at once beginning and end, divided as beginning and end (Heidegger on Ort as point of spear, and fromm, Frömmigkeit, from promos, what leads, l’avant-garde)

SW.content: veil given by God, and giving here is ordering (donner c’est ici ordonner)
c’est un don qu’ils ordonnent [re: regulations of tallith]

CHM.content: Foucault’s Decision (re: point where madness & reason were split): both a fiat/decree/order & schism/dissension/caesura > this dissension is internal (cleavage, torment, w/in act of sentire), fission that divides it along lines of Hegelian Entzweiung [rupture, diremption]

TB.content: sacred text is transferability making its translation untranslatable
sacred text (absolute text): pas de sens (not poverty of meaning, but no meaning that would be itself) > sacred text surrenders itself to translation; commands right away the translation it refuses

TR.content: concept of “machine” indissociable from deconstruction: “a text whose grammaticality is a logical code obeys a machine” > no text w/out grammar, w/out machine, w/out “suspension of referential meaning”

PSSS.content: Kant (said this better than anyone): no right w/out coercion
juridical decision approaches ideal of justice to extent that the community has at its disposal force of constraint to command respect for its ideal
imperative will always be the question of principle, the principle, of sovereign prince, princedom

TN.content: il y a la (là) du tact > given as given as much as ordered (do touch but avoid contact)
philosophy under thumb of finger and eye
order of presences via haptical (if it was a finger point, command)

ATM.content: “he will have obligated (il aura obligé),” a phrase knotted up (se noue) in a certain way of tying (lier), a serial structure of a singular type > edges of the sentence in fog, belong to the night
what to make of a signature [Levinas’] when “il aura obligé,” when Il signs in his place?
how does one hear “one must” in Derrida’s polysemic “l’oeuvre d’E.L. aura obligé”

CIN.content: a desire, order, prayer or promise: “another voice, may it come soon now, again, another voice…”

BSi.content: à pas de loup (wolf), à pas de colombe (dove) (silent commands order world); wolf, war (hunting), dove, order, peace > both silent
obey what protects (double meaning of obliger) > when state says, “I protect you,” it institutes a fear that obliges you, subjects you [Donald Trump]
[re: “Snake”] sovereign as guest (hôte) commands, the first comer, comes before me
threshold as solid, indivisible, threshold as arkhē: commencement and commandment > archon, figure of sovereign himself

OG.content: interior holy voice of faith; natural law, native unity of voice & writing is prescriptive, commandment > good writing comprehended as that which had to be comprehended
factum of phonetic writing commands our entire culture/science, not one fact among others > still, does not respond to a necessity of an absolute/universal essence

EU.content: via Kant, government must arrest its own power in face of freedom (Montesquieu) > philosophy as absolute freedom but can’t give orders (who could be trained to inspect this?)
